title: 【翻訳失敗】Second macOS Tahoe 26.3 Beta Now Available for Developers
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Apple today provided the second beta of an upcoming macOS Tahoe 26.3 update to developers for testing purposes, with the update coming four weeks after the launch of the first beta. Developers can download the ‌macOS Tahoe‌ 26.3 update by opening up the System Settings app, selecting the General category, and then choosing Software Update. Beta Updates will need to be enabled, and a free developer account is required. There's no word yet on what's included in ‌macOS Tahoe‌ 26.3, and no new features were found in the first beta. We'll likely see Apple release ‌macOS Tahoe‌ 26.3 at the end of January given past launch timelines.Related Roundup: macOS TahoeRelated Forum: macOS TahoeThis article, "Second macOS Tahoe 26.3 Beta Now Available for Developers" first appeared on MacRumors.comDiscuss this article in our forums

title: 【翻訳失敗】Apple Seeds Second Betas of iOS 26.3 and iPadOS 26.3 to Developers
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Apple today seeded the second betas of upcoming iOS 26.3 and iPadOS 26.3 updates to developers for testing purposes, with the software coming four weeks after the release of the first betas. Registered developers can download the betas from the Settings app on the iPhone or iPad by going to the General section and selecting Software Update, although it appears over-the-air updates may still be rolling out. The downloads are already available from Apple's Developer site. iOS 26.3 adds a new tool for transitioning from an ‌iPhone‌ to an Android device. Transfers can be initiated during the device setup process, and moving data from one device to another can now be done without having to download a specific app. Apple's transfer process supports moving photos, messages, notes, apps, passwords, phone number, and more. The update also includes a Notification Forwarding setting for third-party wearables in the European Union, and there are some minor changes to the Weather wallpaper. More information on what's changed can be found in our iOS 26.3 beta 1 feature list. Apple is expected to release the iOS 26.3 and iPadOS 26.3 to the public at the end of January.Related Roundups: iOS 26, iPadOS 26Related Forum: iOS 26This article, "Apple Seeds Second Betas of iOS 26.3 and iPadOS 26.3 to Developers" first appeared on MacRumors.comDiscuss this article in our forums

title: Intel Driver Package Reportedly Contains "BMG-G31" Arc GPU Firmware Update
summary: （AI制限中のため原文） Many Team Blue enthusiasts were looking forward to a potential unveiling of a larger "Battlemag...
content:
※API制限のため原文を表示します

Many Team Blue enthusiasts were looking forward to a potential unveiling of a larger "Battlemage" gaming graphics card model at CES 2026, but keynote presentations and showroom floor exhibitions were devoid of fresh "Xe2 dGPU" content. Past weekend TechPowerUp reportage positioned the heavily speculated Arc "Battlemage" B770 design as the fifth greatest "no-show" at the recently concluded Las Vegas-based trade event. The "BMG-G31" GPU die codename has popped up regularly—via official sources and leaks alike—in recent times; leading to theories of an imminent product reveal. Late last week, web sleuths stumbled upon a downloadable folder that contained a "BMG-G31" firmware update. Apparently, an Intel driver package—relating to an HP-made "Panther Lake" laptop—was thoroughly examined. Several PC hardware news outlets have broached the "B770" topic with Team Blue contacts at CES 2026, but no further details—of a notable unreleased product—were disclosed during the busy work week. Within the first half of January, Intel's "Panther Lake" mobile chips have taken precedence, although the adjacent "Wildcat Lake" APU was introduced in an extremely low-key way. The latest leak indicates the readying of drivers for some sort of consumer-level "BMG-G31" graphics product. The fourth quarter 2025 rumor mill pointed to a possible 300 W TDP-rated "B770" mainstream gaming

title: (PR) Bandai Namco Details My Hero Academia: All's Justice Team Up Mission & Hero's Diary Modes
summary: （AI制限中のため原文） The epic saga of My Hero Academia has drawn to a close, but the adventure continues! Relive the exci...
content:
※API制限のため原文を表示します

The epic saga of My Hero Academia has drawn to a close, but the adventure continues! Relive the excitement and immerse yourself in the world of the anime with the highly anticipated release of My Hero Academia: All's Justice. The game features a story mode that lets you relive the anime's final season as well as play original missions crafted specifically for the game. Join us for a unique look here as we delve into the creation of these unique, game-original scenarios. Unique, original game modes My Hero Academia: All's Justice offers two original game modes to enjoy: Team Up Mission and Hero's Diary, which is unlocked by completing Team Up Mission. In TeamUp Mission, you'll become a student in Class 1-A at U.A. High School and experience hero activities in a virtual space that mirrors the U.A. High Class 1-A student activity. Use the Quirks of the students in Class 1-A to take on parkour movements and various missions, fully enjoying your hero activities. Hero's Diary is a mode where you can catch a glimpse of the unknown daily lives of the Class 1-A students. Enjoy three episodes each for all 20 students to your heart's content. Read full story

title: 【翻訳失敗】Formovie's Chapter One 4K Projector Uses Liquid Cooling to Reduce Noise Levels
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: At CES 2020, Formovie showcased the Xming Chapter One LCD projector. Its main feature is the Liquid Cooling System (LQC) designed to reduce noise and keep brightness levels stable, compared with classic air-cooled variants. While liquid cooling is already starting to be included by others in some of their latest 4K models (i.e., Anker Nebula X1 or Hisense XR10), it is nice to see that this technology is spreading also to more mainstream products like this one. The Chapter One is powered by a MediaTek MT9660 processor and supports MEMC (Motion Estimation, Motion Compensation) smoothing, autofocus, and automatic keystone correction. It has a native FHD 1920 × 1080 resolution and is rated for up to 2,000 ISO lumens. The projector also has a sealed optical engine to prevent dust from entering the optical elements. It also offers USB 2.0 and Dual HDMI 1.4 ports while Dolby Audio is listed for the integrated speakers, with no detailed audio specifications disclosed. Pricing and availability will be announced at a later date.

content:

DuneCrawl is now out on PC (Steam)! DuneCrawl is an open world action-adventure game, where you take to the sandy seas atop a gigantic crustacean festooned with black powder cannons. Play as a solo Crab Keeper, or with a crew of up to three other friends in local and online coop. Battle against the jar-headed Vassals, survive hordes of wild bugs, explore oasis islands and delve devious dungeons all to help your fellow Polloi pilgrims win their war against the Ceramicist's invasion! Navigate your Dune Crawler through the desert and visit dozens of islands to complete quests, explore secret dungeons, and collect piles of loot! Gain powerful new player abilities by collecting Masks, Tunics, and Talismans! Unlock weapons like the Buzzooka and Acid Harpoon! title: Hyper Demoed its HyperSpace Trackpad Pro and More at CES
summary: （AI制限中のため原文） Targus subsidiary Hyper, had some rather interesting products on display at this year's CES, at leas...
content:
※API制限のため原文を表示します

Targus subsidiary Hyper, had some rather interesting products on display at this year's CES, at least if you're looking for accessories for your notebooks that stick out a bit from the crowd. First up is the HyperSpace Trackpad Pro which the company claims is the first "premium haptic trackpad" that has been designed specifically for use with Windows. Hyper claims it has zero latency input, a 240 Hz report rate and pressure sensing for up to 10 fingers. Next up we have the new HyperDrive Next USB4 M.2 PCIe enclosure that is said to support USB4 V2, suggesting it's based on an Intel JHL9480 Thunderbolt 5 accessory controller, as no other chip supports 80 Gbps throughput (limited to 64 Gbps for data). Note that the product name doesn't limit the device to just storage, as Hyper claims it can be used for connecting other M.2 add-in cards to your computer. It's unclear if the second Type-C port allows for daisy changing, but it should support 25 W power input for devices that require more power than the Thunderbolt interface can deliver. Read full story

title: Google Says Gemini Partnership With Apple Will Go Beyond Siri Revamp
summary: （AI制限中のため原文） Google today announced that its AI platform Gemini will help power not only a more personalized vers...
content:
※API制限のため原文を表示します

Google today announced that its AI platform Gemini will help power not only a more personalized version of Siri, but a range of future Apple Intelligence features. "Apple and Google have entered into a multi-year collaboration under which the next generation of Apple Foundation Models will be based on Google's Gemini models and cloud technology," said Google, in a statement. "These models will help power future Apple Intelligence features, including a more personalized Siri coming this year." Apple is "excited about the innovative new experiences" that the partnership will unlock, but the statement did not provide any details about specific features. It is unclear if Gemini will help power any existing Apple Intelligence features, such as Writing Tools, Image Playground, and Notification Summaries. Apple Intelligence will continue to run on Apple devices and on Apple's Private Cloud Compute servers, with Apple promising industry-leading privacy standards. The more personalized version of Siri is expected to be introduced with iOS 26.4 in March or April, following a lengthy delay. The new capabilities will include better understanding of a user's personal context, on-screen awareness, and deeper per-app controls. For example, Apple showed an iPhone user asking Siri about their mother's flight and lunch reservation plans based on info from the Mail and Messages apps. Apple and Google have entered into a multi-year collaboration under which the next generatio

title: 【翻訳失敗】Targus Showed New Laptop Accessories at CES
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Targus might very well be the best known brand of laptop bags and accessories in the world and at CES this year, the company brought with it a range of new products. First up we have Targus' new Voyager EXP travel backpack that the company says was developed for mobile professionals and frequent travelers. It fits up to a 17-inch notebook and can be expanded from 27 to 30 litres. Tagus mentions that it's been designed to not only protect your laptop, but it also has an RFID blocking compartment and lockable zippers, as well as a trolley straps for when you travel with a suitcase. Targus also had a range of new mobile docks on display, some of which have USB4 support and the ability to pass through up to 140 W of USB PD power. The USB4 docks also support 8K video output to a single display or 4K output to two displays. Unfortunately our team didn't manage to snap a pic of the new docks, so we borrowed one from Targus. In addition to this, Targus also showed some new magnetic privacy screens and a range of other laptop bags made from recycled plastic bottles, some of which you can see below.

title: Apple Confirms Google Gemini Will Power Next-Generation Siri This Year
summary: （AI制限中のため原文） In a statement shared with CNBC today, Apple confirmed that Google Gemini will power the next-genera...
content:
※API制限のため原文を表示します

In a statement shared with CNBC today, Apple confirmed that Google Gemini will power the next-generation version of Siri that is slated to launch later this year. "After careful evaluation, we determined that Google's technology provides the most capable foundation for Apple Foundation Models and we're excited about the innovative new experiences it will unlock for our users," the statement said. The report explicitly mentioned that Google Gemini will power Siri, as was expected. Apple's decision to lean on Google's artificial intelligence technology should result in the revamped Siri being more capable and advanced than it otherwise would have been, as Gemini's large language model is significantly larger than Apple's own model. The next-generation version of Siri is expected to be introduced with iOS 26.4, which will likely be released to the general public in March or April. Apple first announced the personalized Siri features during its WWDC 2024 keynote, but last year it announced that they were delayed. The new capabilities will include better understanding of a user's personal context, on-screen awareness, and deeper per-app controls. For example, Apple showed an iPhone user asking Siri about their mother's flight and lunch reservation plans based on info from the Mail and Messages apps.Related Roundups: iOS 26, iPadOS 26Tag: SiriRelated Forum: iOS 26This article, "Apple Confirms Google Gemini Will Power Next-Generation Siri This Year" first app

title: 【翻訳失敗】GUNNIR's Ultra-slim Arc Pro B50 Low Profile Graphics Card Spotted at CES
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Gunnir has added another custom Arc Pro B50 16 GB custom card design to its lineup of Xe2-HPG "Battlemage" GPU-based workstation products. The Chinese manufacturer's low profile variant was shown off in a low-key manner at the recently concluded CES trade show; specifically at Minisforum's booth. As a quick reminder, it must be noted that the mini PC specialist also exhibited Vastarmor's Radeon RX 9060 XT LP 16 GB custom graphics card on the same table. The single-slot thick Gunnir Arc Pro B50 LP model seems to conform to Intel reference specs; its BMG-G21 GPU is configured with 1700 MHz base and 2600 MHz boost clocks. The card is 70 W TDP-rated. According to initial press material—issued last month—the company's engineers have crammed this level of professional hardware into a 167 x 69 x 18.4 mm package. Like the majority of modern-day Intel Arc Pro board partners, Gunnir has deployed a blower-style cooling solution. The TechPowerUp team inspected a demonstration sample that still had protective film applied across its shroud and backplate. No details—regarding release times and pricing—were ascertained from Minisforum representatives on the showroom floor. Gunnir tends to favor the PC market in China with launches of Pro-line products.

title: 【翻訳失敗】Report: Rise of AI Is Corroding Apple's Influence Over TSMC
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: A detailed new report from SemiAnalysis argues that while Apple's partnership with TSMC created the modern leading-edge foundry model, the rapid rise of AI computing is changing who pays for new chip technologies and how much influence Apple holds over each new manufacturing node. The report traces how Apple became the single most important customer in the global semiconductor industry by committing early and at scale to new manufacturing processes at TSMC, beginning with the A8 chip in 2014. It argues that Apple's willingness to absorb early costs, fund yield improvements, and align its annual product cycle with TSMC's roadmap allowed the foundry to outpace rivals and cement its dominance at the leading edge. Apple's annual spending at TSMC grew from roughly $2 billion in 2014 to about $24 billion in 2025, while Apple's share of TSMC revenue rose from single digits to as much as 25% at its peak. For much of the past decade, Apple accounted for more than half of initial production at each new node, and in some cases nearly all of it, effectively underwriting the financing of advanced manufacturing when no other customer could do so at scale. However, the rise of AI accelerators has created a second class of customers, such as NVIDIA, who are capable of consuming large amounts of advanced manufacturing capacity. TSMC's revenue mix has shifted significantly as a result. Smartphones once represented nearly half of TSMC's revenue, but that share has fallen as high-performance computing demands, including AI, have grown to become the largest segment. This means Apple is no longer the only customer capable of funding new capacity, even though it remains the largest single customer by revenue. This change is said to already be visible with upcoming manufacturing nodes. Apple's share of early production for TSMC's N2 and A16 nodes is expected to be lower than previous generations, the latter of which is designed for high-performance computing workloads rather than mobile devices. Under SemiAnalysis's modeling, Apple's position strengthens again at later nodes such as A14, which are being designed from the start to support both mobile and high-performance products. In that scenario, Apple's share of early capacity rises again as its iPhone and Mac chips return to being the primary drivers of volume. While Apple continues to rely on TSMC for its most advanced chips, SemiAnalysis says the company is exploring alternatives for lower-risk components and certain categories to diversify its supply chain. Intel's upcoming 18A-P process is a potential option for some Apple silicon without disrupting flagship products. See SemiAnalysis's full report for more information.Tag: TSMCThis article, "Report: Rise of AI Is Corroding Apple's Influence Over TSMC" first appeared on MacRumors.comDiscuss this article in our forums

title: (PR) Stoic Details Towerborne's Upcoming Full Release - Title Exits Early Access on February 26
summary: （AI制限中のため原文） First and foremost, we at Stoic want to take a moment and salute our amazing community who joined us...
content:
※API制限のため原文を表示します

First and foremost, we at Stoic want to take a moment and salute our amazing community who joined us in the Towerborne early access journey. It's no exaggeration to say that the game would not be what it is without our community. Thank you to every Ace for your valuable feedback, passion, ideas and dedication which shaped Towerborne into our full game release. That's right, we're excited to announce that we will be exiting early access and Xbox Game Preview and launching our full game on February 26, 2026, on Xbox, PC, Steam and PlayStation 5. This is all tied to a major 1.0 update to the game, and a shift in how you play and access. For those who have been with us from the start, there is a lot of new content and updates for you. And for those who will experience Towerborne for the first time, welcome! Let's jump in. Read full story

summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: EINAREX brought a slew of new cases, CPU coolers, and high-performance case fans to the 2026 International CES. We begin our coverage with the Ventus V300, s premium dual fin-stack air CPU cooler that comes in black and white color variants, featuring six 6 mm-thick copper heat-pipes, and two 120 mm fans in push-pull configuration, with a top-plate spanning the fin-stacks and the middle fan. This cooler handles thermal loads of 260 W+, making it fit for processors with maximum turbo power of 250 W or above. We've also seen the EINAREX Glide G300, a more compacted version of the Ventus V300. There's also a fancy variant of this cooler with a wood-like top-plate. Each of the two fans comes with fluid-dynamic bearings. Next up, are the EINAREX Vertex line of all-in-one liquid CPU coolers. These come with a cube-shaped pump-block with a partial, cuboidal glass ornament that puts out an infinite-reflection of an ARGB-illuminated EINAREX logo. The fans included with this cooler lack ARGB lighting, but feature fluid dynamic bearings. EINAREX Flux is a line of value AIO CLCs that feature a round, puck-shaped, classic Asetek-styled pump-block. There's an ARGB-lit logo inside an infinite-reflection ornament, and unlike the Vertex, the fans included with this cooler come with ARGB LED lighting in the fan frames. At CES, the company launched a more premium version of the Flux, the Flux Digital, which features an LED segment display that puts out CPU temperature, utilization, and GPU temperature readouts that the cooler pulls from software over USB and ACPI. Read full story

title: 【翻訳失敗】(PR) MSI Unveils the PRO DP10 A14MG Mini PC
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: MSI proudly announces the new PRO DP10 A14MG, a compact and slim 1.1-liter mini PC engineered for modern business environments that demand performance, Safety, and space-saving flexibility. Despite its small size, the PRO DP10 A14MG features a desktop-grade 14th Generation Intel Core i7 processor, providing the speed and responsiveness necessary for multitasking, data processing, and enterprise-level workflows. Designed for any office or commercial environment, the PRO DP10 A14MG supports triple-display setups and features dual 2.5G LAN ports, ensuring smooth multitasking and reliable high-bandwidth networking. Its configurable ports allow businesses to select the ideal input/output (I/O) combination, with default HDMI + 2.5G LAN and optional combinations such as HDMI + COM, DP + 2.5G LAN, DP + COM, VGA + 2.5G LAN, and VGA + COM, in the factory. This versatility makes it suitable for kiosks, POS terminals, digital signage, and office deployments. Read full story

title: CTX Shows 540 Hz QHD OLED Gaming Monitor at CES 2026
summary: （AI制限中のため原文） CTX, a Taiwanese monitor maker, has used its CES 2026 booth to display some amazing gaming monitors ...
content:
※API制限のため原文を表示します

CTX, a Taiwanese monitor maker, has used its CES 2026 booth to display some amazing gaming monitors at various resolutions and refresh rates. One of the most notable models is the company's OM 27, a 27-inch 2560x1440p resolution OLED display running at an impressive 540 Hz refresh rate. With brightness scaling up to 1500 cd/m², the display is one of the fastest OLED panels at QHD resolution. CTX targets e-sports professionals who require high refresh rate, but decided to go with a QHD resolution to make modern GPUs a great pair to push these frame rates. The company advertises 0.03 ms response time, and embedded a single DisplayPort 2.1, two HDMI 2.0, and a single USB Type-C serving as power delivery of 96 W, plus a single audio output jack. The monitor supports AMD's FreeSync Premium, comes with DisplayHDR 400, and much more. As a display OEM, many companies will adopt this panel in their monitor solutions. Read full story

title: Three-D Desk Shows Workstations That Transform at CES 2026
summary: （AI制限中のため原文） At CES 2026, Three-D Desk showcased its ergonomic desktop workstation lineup, featuring the LS160 St...
content:
※API制限のため原文を表示します

At CES 2026, Three-D Desk showcased its ergonomic desktop workstation lineup, featuring the LS160 Standard, LD160 Premium, and LT160 Standard models. Each model is designed to cater to different workspace needs, all while emphasizing the company's posture-first ergonomics of use. The range includes features like electrically adjustable height and tilt, as well as support for multi-monitor setups, making it ideal for CAD designers, content creators, or anyone needing a flexible, hardware-friendly workstation. The LD160 is the premium option for dual monitors, offering a larger work surface and features tailored for power users. Meanwhile, the LT160 and LS160 provide more compact, standard configurations suitable for smaller offices or home setups. The LD160 can also support a single ultrawide monitor for a more bezel-free experience. These models are already available, but for pricing details, you need to check their website or contact a local distributor. According to the plaque at CES, the basic version starts at $4,000 and can go up to $7,000.

title: 【翻訳失敗】(PR) ID-Cooling Updates SE-XT V2 ARGB Air Coolers Without Price Changes
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: ID-Cooling, a leading PC DIY brand focused on practical and accessible cooling solutions, has announced updates to its SE air cooler lineup with the SE-903-XT V2 BLACK and SE-214-XT V2 series. According to ID-Cooling, the refreshed SE-XT V2 lineup brings structural and thermal improvements while maintaining the same pricing as the previous generation. Upgraded SE-XT V2 Series Design Both models feature Heatpipe Direct Touch (HDT) technology, allowing heat to transfer directly from the CPU into the heat pipes without an additional material layer. The upgraded folded-fin stack design enhances structural stability and cooling efficiency. Both supporting full RAM compatibility in both single- and dual-fan configurations. Read full story

title: 【翻訳失敗】HKC Showed Off 5K Dimming Zone RGB MiniLED Tech at CES
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Display panel manufacturer HKC was showing off its latest RGB MiniLED tech during CES and the company is working on its own display driver for this up and coming display technology. The chip is simply named the HV9901, but promises to be capable of driving over 5,000 RGB MiniLED dimming zones, or alternatively over 15,000 white MiniLED dimming zones. HKC also has its own RGB MiniLED panel which goes under the name of M10 Ultra and should be capable to deliver over 98 percent of the BT.2020 colour space and deliver up to 1000 nits brightness, while still delivering near OLED blacks. The M10 Ultra panel on display at CES was a 31.5-inch panel with 4K resolution and a 165 Hz refresh rate, with a 1080p/330 Hz dual mode option. The panel is DisplayHDR 1400 certified and has a 2 ms GtG response time, but there was no mention of how many dimming zones it offers. The demo unit also featured a pair of HDMI 2.1 ports, a DisplayPort 2.1 port and a USB Type-C port with 90 W USB PD and DP Alt Mode support. In addition to that, HKC was also showing a dual mode 1440p display capable of 540 Hz, or 1080 Hz at 720p. Unfortunately no other specs were provided for this demo unit.

title: 【翻訳失敗】RUIX Gaming at 2026 CES: New Cases and PSUs
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: RUIX Gaming made its CES debut this year, with a slick new lineup of cases, PSUs, and cooling products. Starting things off, we have the company's new RT series of premium ATX 3.1 PSUs. These come in 750 W, 850 W, 1000 W, and 1200 W variants, although the 1000 W model was missing in the booth. The series meets ATX 3.1 and PCIe 5.1 CEM specs, and offers 600 W-capable 12V-2x6 connectors on all models 850 W thru 1200 W, while the 750 W model comes with a 450 W-capable 12V-2x6. These PSUs are characterized by an airy chassis that allows for better ventilation of all its hot components, and a 120 mm fan to keep cool. The PSUs themselves have a space-saving 150 mm depth. All included cables are individually sleeved. Next up, is the RUIX Gaming OV 703, a spacious ATX mid-tower with a pillarless front-left edge, with tempered glass along the left and front panel. The case offers clearances of 41 cm for graphics cards, and 18 cm height for CPU coolers. The bottom compartment has two 3.5-inch/2.5-inch drive trays, and an additional 2.5-inch mount. The case comes in white and black color options, and measures 456 mm x 222 mm x 465 mm (DxWxH). The CV 303 is a mid-tower with a slatted mesh intake along the front-panel, and three 140 mm front fan mounts, and three 120 mm mounts along the partition between the two compartments. This, too, comes in black and white, and measures 470 mm x 226 mm x 480 mm. Lastly, the company showed off its upcoming AeroSpace Pro Max case with a ridged LED diffuser along the bottom compartment, a style that closely resembles ASUS ROG Strix graphics cards. More pictures follow.Read full story

title: 【翻訳失敗】Apple Tops 2025 Smartphone Market With 20% Share, 10% Growth
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Apple emerged as the global smartphone market leader in 2025, capturing a 20% market share with 10% year-over-year shipment growth – the highest among the top five brands, according to data released today by Counterpoint Research. Global smartphone shipments grew 2% year-over-year in 2025, marking the second consecutive year of growth. Counterpoint said the market was driven by more consumers taking advantage of financing options to upgrade to premium devices, as well as increasing adoption of 5G devices in emerging markets. Samsung ranked second behind Apple with a 19% market share and modest 5% shipment growth, while Xiaomi retained third place with 13% share. "Apple's growth in 2025 was driven by its expanding presence and rising demand across emerging and mid-size markets, supported by a stronger product mix," said Counterpoint senior analyst Varun Mishra. "The iPhone 17 series gained significant traction in Q4 following its successful launch, while the iPhone 16 continued to perform exceptionally well in Japan, India and Southeast Asia." Apple's performance was said to have been amplified by the pandemic-era upgrade cycle reaching an inflection point, with millions of users due for device replacement. In Q4 2025, Apple accounted for one-quarter of global shipments, its highest-ever quarterly share, according to the report. While U.S. tariff concerns prompted manufacturers to front-load shipments in the first half of the year, the impact actually proved milder than anticipated, and the effects on second-half volumes were limited. However, Counterpoint's outlook for 2026 is more conservative. "The global smartphone market is set to soften in 2026 amid DRAM/NAND shortages and rising component costs, as chipmakers prioritize AI data centers over smartphones," said Counterpoint research director Tarun Pathak. The firm has subsequently revised its 2026 forecast downward by 3%, although Apple and Samsung are expected to remain resilient thanks to their stronger supply chain capabilities.Tag: CounterpointThis article, "Apple Tops 2025 Smartphone Market With 20% Share, 10% Growth" first appeared on MacRumors.comDiscuss this article in our forums

title: 【翻訳失敗】Google Chrome 150 Will Be Last Version to Support macOS Monterey
summary: AI生成に失敗しました。原文を確認してください。
content: Google has confirmed that its Chrome 150 browser update coming later this year will be the last version to support macOS Monterey. Going forward, Chrome 150 and later versions will no longer support macOS 12, which Apple released in October 2021. In a platform status update, Google says that on Macs running Monterey, Chrome 150 will continue to work, but the browser will display a warning infobar and will not update any further. For new installations of Chrome 151+, macOS 13 or newer will be required. Google has not announced an exact release date for Chrome 150. But based on the current stable channel being at version 143 and that Google typically releases major new Chrome versions roughly every four weeks, Chrome 150 is likely to be rolled out sometime around mid-2026. To stay up-to-date with the latest browsing standards and to maintain online security, users on Monterey should update their macOS version, or choose another third-party browser like Firefox that is still receiving updates for their version of macOS.Tag: Google ChromeThis article, "Google Chrome 150 Will Be Last Version to Support macOS Monterey" first appeared on MacRumors.comDiscuss this article in our forums
